C

cascadeDelete(Client) - Method in class businessLogic.ClientBusinessLogic
This method cascades the delete operation such that if a client is deleted, all the orders made by that client are deleted as well.
cascadeDelete(Orders) - Method in class businessLogic.OrderBusinessLogic
This method cascades the delete operation done on an order such that all the order items that belonged to the order specified as the parameter are deleted as well.
cascadeDelete(OrderItem) - Method in class businessLogic.OrderItemBusinessLogic
This method cascades the delete operation such that if an order item is deleted, the total prices of that corresponding order is updated.
cascadeDelete(Product) - Method in class businessLogic.ProductBusinessLogic
This method cascades the delete operation such that if a product is deleted, all the order items that contain the product given as the parameter are deleted as well.
cascadeUpdate(Client) - Method in class businessLogic.ClientBusinessLogic
This method cascades the update operation such that if the id of the client given as the parameter is changed, it should change across all the orders that were made by that client.
cascadeUpdate(Orders) - Method in class businessLogic.OrderBusinessLogic
This method cascades the update operation such that if the id of the order given as the parameter is changed, it should change across all the order items that are part of this order.
city - Variable in class model.Client
The city of the client stored in the database.
CityValidator - Class in businessLogic.validators
 
CityValidator() - Constructor for class businessLogic.validators.CityValidator
 
Client - Class in model
Provides the class "Client" linked to the table "client" in the ordermng.db database.
Client() - Constructor for class model.Client
Constructor for the Client.java class without any arguments.
Client(int, String, String) - Constructor for class model.Client
Constructor for the Client.java class when the id_client is known.
Client(String, String) - Constructor for class model.Client
Constructor for the Client.java class when the id_client is unknown.
ClientAccess - Class in access
This class provides the application access to the "ordermng.db" database.
ClientAccess() - Constructor for class access.ClientAccess
 
clientAccess - Variable in class businessLogic.ClientBusinessLogic
The instance of the ClientAccess.java class to access the database.
ClientBusinessLogic - Class in businessLogic
This class provides the application with a working layer between the UI and the classes that access the database.
ClientBusinessLogic() - Constructor for class businessLogic.ClientBusinessLogic
The constructor of this class.
clientID - Static variable in class start.order.manager.MainClass
Global id for the client.
close(Connection) - Static method in class connection.ConnectionFactory
 
close(Statement) - Static method in class connection.ConnectionFactory
 
close(ResultSet) - Static method in class connection.ConnectionFactory
 
connection - package connection
 
ConnectionFactory - Class in connection
 
ConnectionFactory() - Constructor for class connection.ConnectionFactory
 
createConnection() - Method in class connection.ConnectionFactory
 
createDeleteQuery(String) - Method in class access.AbstractAccess
This method builds and UPDATE query of the form: UPDATE T SET deleted = true WHERE id = ?
createInsertQuery(List<String>) - Method in class access.AbstractAccess
This method builds an INSERT query of the form: INSERT INTO T (column1, column2, ...) VALUES (value1, value2, ...)
createObjects(ResultSet) - Method in class access.AbstractAccess
This method creates a list from the result set of a query.
createSelectAllQuery() - Method in class access.AbstractAccess
This method builds a SELECT query without any conditions, of the form: SELECT * FROM T
createSelectQuery(String) - Method in class access.AbstractAccess
This method builds a SELECT query with a single condition, of the form: SELECT * FROM T WHERE field=?
createUpdateQuery(List<String>) - Method in class access.AbstractAccess
This method builds an UPDATE query of the form: UPDATE T SET (column1=value1, column2=value2, ...) WHERE id = ?
